page.title: 01General review Papa Westray
page.content: The island of Papa Westray is one of the most Northerly of the Orkneys.It has a population of 80 in 1985. The North end of the island is an R.S.P.B. bird reserve and contains the largest piece of maritime heath left in the islands. There are many archaeological sites, the main one of which is the Knap of Howar which dates from about 3500B.C. The main occupation is farming, both beef cattle and sheep.There is also some crab and lobster fishing and building. The services include a general store, post office, hostel and guest house. The island has a resident teacher and nurse but shares a minister and doctor with the neighbouring island of Westray.Transport is by both boat and plane from Kirkwall on the Orkney mainland.
